definition: to make fun of/to seek diversion

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: The children are always up to amusing tricks.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們總是調皮搗蛋尋開心。

sentences.english: No more money left to have fun.
sentences.chinese: 沒有多餘的錢去尋開心。

sentences.english: The Duke goes where he's amused.
sentences.chinese: 哪裏能尋開心，公爵就到哪裏去。

sentences.english: Don't let them kid you, big boy .
sentences.chinese: 別讓他們拿你尋開心，大孩子。

sentences.english: I was at a night out - only just made the train.
sentences.chinese: 我晚上出去尋開心，差點誤了火車。我沒有吵醒你吧？

sentences.english: Those stupid boys used to amuse themselves by tossing rocks at passing cars.
sentences.chinese: 那些愚蠢的男孩子過去常朝過往車輛扔石頭，尋開心。

sentences.english: They want to be self-sufficiently happy.
sentences.chinese: 他們喜歡靠自己尋開心。

sentences.english: He made fun of a girl in a wheelchair at his school.
sentences.chinese: 他在學校裏還拿一個坐輪椅的小姑娘尋開心。

definition: lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: to leak (of air)/to go flat (of a tire)/to vent one's anger
to get straight to the point (idiom)
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
